What we need instead of "fact checkers" is just "fact researchers."

My favorite so far is Widow's "Mistletoe Kiss" highlight.

"Oh ok. That makes more sense."

There was this absent minded guy that worked with me at TSA. I always liked him and he was friendly. He appeared dumb at first, but he would have these moments of clarity that made me think he wasn't dumb at all.
One day I walk in the break room and he's doodling on a piece of paper. I take a look and recognize some of the math symbols from calculus.
"What are you writing?", I asked.
"Oh, I had thought about this theorem I wanted to flesh out." He scratched his head in thought.
So after this I talked to him more. He was literally a rocket scientist for NASA. He was in his 50s and said he just got burned out from it and decided to find a job that would allow him to relax.
I was going to read it, but CNN told me it's illegal to do it.
Damn Russian judges.

I think the biggest problem Perrin has is losing himself to them. He still remembers that wolfbrother that had been lost and worries about it.
Perrin himself has a hard time letting go of being a "blacksmith", and I think the aspect of communicating with wolves makes it worse for him.

I have two boys with autism and constantly see jokes about someone being so "autistic" because they act goofy. I don't personally like it, but realize they are trying to use edgy humor to get a laugh. Most people that make jokes like that wouldn't openly laugh at someone with autism or OCD.
I personally think she looks like a spoiled entitled brat and needs to get a sense of humor. You should be able to laugh at yourself and take jokes in stride, especially if they aren't mean spirited.

If the only solution to your problem is more money without a measurable goal, you need focus on the root cause of the problem.
It hasn't worked on education, poverty, terrorism, or climate change. Why? Because people are speculating on how to solve a problem when they aren't sure what caused the problem in the first place.
